body:
### Problem

Hi!

There's a hard-to-reproduce situation in which `neovim` crashes on my machine (macbook).
Being a Vim user for more than a decade, I got used to not seeing my text editor seg-faulting on me. You can imagine my "what just happened?" reaction when I saw the terminal suddenly returning to shell prompt.

Anyway, here are the details:

The crash happened while resizing the terminal emulator window in which neovim was running with more than 6 tabs, each having vertical and horizontal splits with some of the splits executing ongoing shell scripts in `terminal` mode.

I'm using `neovim` installed with `Homebrew`:
```sh
# nvim -v
NVIM v0.11.0
Build type: Release
LuaJIT 2.1.1744318430
Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info
```

The terminal emulator is `alacritty`:
```sh
# alacritty --version
alacritty 0.15.1 (0c405d5)
```

The crash log (from `Console`):
```
Process:               nvim [1868]
Path:                  /opt/homebrew/*/nvim
Identifier:            nvim
Version:               ???
Code Type:             ARM-64 (Native)
Parent Process:        Exited process [1867]
```

### Steps to reproduce

Hard to reproduce.

### Expected behavior

Not crashing.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

15.4.1

### Terminal name/version

alacritty/0.15.1

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

homebrew

comment_data.body: the latest release is Nvim 0.11.1. also try Nvim 0.12
Ok, I've upgraded to 0.11.1 (via homebrew). I'll let you know if it crashes again.

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: Segfault in macos when terminal emulator window resizes
